intro: Lysanthe, commonly known as the sweet sultan, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Its foliage consists of large, velvety leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Lysanthe is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and floral arrangements.
